data.title: Alvaro de la Camara on LinkedIn: Saying Im proud of Care Providers' Voice

This gathering is more than just a lunch‚Äîit's a unique opportunity to: ü§ù Connect: Engage with like-minded professionals from various industries in Alabama. üß† Learn: Gain insights from fellow members, sharing valuable knowledge and experiences. üåê Network: Build connections that transcend professional boundaries and foster collaboration. üöÄ Why Attend? 1Ô∏è‚É£ Unlock fresh perspectives on healthcare challenges in Alabama. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Share your expertise and learn from others. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Expand your network and strengthen professional relationships. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Access valuable insights to navigate the ever-evolving healthcare landscape. üë• Who Should Attend? Employers, benefits advisors, and professionals passionate about transforming healthcare in Alabama. Secure your spot for a luncheon filled with knowledge-sharing and networking. Your active participation contributes to a healthier and more informed Alabama! Let's come together, learn, and grow as we pave the way for positive changes in healthcare. See you there! #EmployerHealthcare #AEHCStrategyForSuccess #AlabamaEmployers #AlabamaHealthcare #Benefits #JoinAEHC2024

On 30 August 2023, in the Q&A portion of a webinar for Meetings Today (which should be available soon for viewing on demand) on which I spoke about on #risk and #contingency planning for #meetings and #events, I was asked about #boycotts of cities after discussing, as part of the content, laws enacted that are causing groups to reconsider what cities to select. I said there are many reasons groups choose not to send RFPs or select cities. One example: long-ago, very high New York City #HotelTaxes as a reason many groups didn't select the city for meetings. The result? Lowering of those taxes. In the content was the consideration of available #MedicalCare when selecting a destination. Today, news of the closing of the only hospital in the third largest Oregon city made me wonder - in addition to the crisis for the residents - a) how the DMO (#CVB) will sell the city and what they will tell groups about care and b) if not selecting a city for lack of care is 'boycotting.' What say you? https://lnkd.in/edZp8Qkb Travel Unity Destinations International HSMAI PCMA Headquarters ASAE: The Center for Association Leadership APIEventProfs Meeting Professionals International National Coalition of Black Meeting Professionals Society of Government Meeting Professionals (SGMP) International Association of Exhibitions and Events (IAEE) Events Industry Council International Association of Venue Managers IACC Meetings Amanda Cecil Tyra Warner Alan Kleinfeld Julius Solaris BizBash
